Description: Signet-ring. Sintered quartz scarab set in gold mount. It has flattened bow-shaped hoop of electrum, the edges of which are set into gold covered collars. Fine wire is neatly wound around each shoulder, to half the circumference. The scarab is broken but complete. Human-headed sphinx wearing the Red Crown of Lower Egypt (?) forms the principal element in the design; in front is falcon holding a flail.
Bibliographic references: Barnett & Mendleson 1987a / Tharros; A Catalogue of Material in the British Museum from Phoenician and other Tombs at Tharros, Sardinia (26/14)
